availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Henry Percy Anderson (Buckinghamshire, England, Attache to the British Ambassador)

body.p: Buckinghamshire, England, ambassador. Native of Brighton, England. Clerk in Foreign Office in Buckinghamshire in 1861. Attache to Queen Victoria's legation in Washington D. C., in 1862. Knight Commander of the Order of Bath and Knight Commander of the Order of St. Michael and St. George.

ab.bibl:
Census Returns of England and Wales (1861), England, Buckinghamshire, Taplow, District 11, p. 14 of 25.
The Annual Register of World Events: A Review of Public Events at Home and Abroad, For the Year 1878, vol. 120 (London: Spottswoode and Co., New-Street Square and Parliament, 1878) 263.
A Directory of British Diplomats (London: Foreign and Commonwealth Office, 2018), 21.
KYR-0001-027-0002.
